name: Lloyd's of London
goal: Lloyd's provides a specialist insurance and reinsurance market based in London. Its legal form is recognised by the EU Insurance and Reinsurance Directives. Its membership comprises of corporate and individual members, each of whom accepts insurance risk on their own account via their membership of Lloyd's underwriting syndicates. Lloyd's is authorised to write insurance from all EU Member States and provides reinsurance to more than 200 countries and territories worldwide.
interests: Budget, Competition, Consumer Affairs, Economic and Financial Affairs, Employment and Social Affairs, Energy, Enterprise, Environment, External Relations, Financial Stability, Financial Services and Capital Markets Union , Foreign and Security Policy and Defence, General and Institutional Affairs, Home Affairs, Internal Market, Justice and Fundamental Rights, Trade
euInitiatives: Solvency II, Insurance Distribution Directive, Data Protection, European System of Financial Supervision review, Network and Information Security Directive, Green Paper on Retail Financial Services.
